newsitem.title: USA: PrimeSource extends share buy back plan.
newsitem.headline: PrimeSource extends share buy back plan.

text.p: PrimeSource Corp said it has extended a stock repurchasing program and will buy back as many as 100,000 shares this year.
In May 1996, the company said it planned to repurchase up to 250,000 shares of the approximately 6.6 million shares outstanding.

President and Chief Executive James Mullan said in a statement that the extension of the repurchase program reflects the company's continued opinion that its common shares are undervalued in the marketplace.
PrimeSource is a national distributor and systems integrator serving the printing, publishing and graphic arts industries.
